call_title: Ergo PoW Blockchain - Weekly Update & AMA - December 19th 2024

topics.title: Cornell BRICK Token LETS System Implementation
topics.summary: QX deployed a blockchain-based payment system for Cornell's large format printing service, creating BRICK token as a Local Exchange Trading System (LETS). Students can pay for printing services using either ERG or BRICK tokens through Discord tipper bot integration with Nautilus wallet.

topics.title: Mac Pro Sales on MewFinance Marketplace
topics.summary: Cornell sold four Mac Pro computers on MewFinance for 65 ERG each, with high demand causing transaction competition. Proceeds will fund the Cornell DAO Treasury for BRICK token airdrops to students.

topics.title: Sigmanauts Multisig Migration and Pool Updates
topics.summary: Sigmanauts completed migration from old multisig to new multisig and Paideia platform. The mining pool is now distributing storage rent payments based on PPLNS block ratios.

topics.title: Quantum Resistance Analysis and Future Planning
topics.summary: Kushti analyzed Ergo's quantum resistance, noting that proof-of-work consensus is already quantum-resistant due to hash functions, while signatures need future upgrades. Post-quantum cryptography would reduce TPS by 10-100x, but quantum computers capable of breaking cryptography are still decades away.

topics.title: Art Events and Property Rights Talk
topics.summary: Kushti recorded a talk for upcoming art events about property rights in programmable money, covering tokenization of art, fractional ownership, and combining artist work with mining through on-chain contracts. The talk connects Tornado Cash decisions to real-world asset tokenization.

topics.title: Local Developer Meetup and Outreach
topics.summary: Kushti attended a local developers meetup where he explained blockchain developments in 2024, with one attendee being Netam, a Sigmanauts pool miner.

topics.title: Storage Rent Collection and Oracle Pools Testing
topics.summary: The mining pool collected significant storage rent payments from large boxes, likely related to Oracle Pools initial testing. Miners are discovering various tokens including test tokens and historical artifacts from the blockchain.

topics.title: Cyberverse Multi-Chain Integration Success
topics.summary: Cyberverse won their poll on Ronin and now supports Ronin, Ergo, and Cardano wallet connectors. Players can buy items with CYPX from any chain and receive NFTs on their origin chain, incentivizing Ergo usage while expanding to other ecosystems.

topics.title: Development Updates and Upcoming Releases
topics.summary: Node 6.0 release candidate expected this week after testing, Sigma interpreter release next week, and sub-blocks discussions resuming. Ledger integration in final audit stages with third-party company. Oracle Pools development completed and Kestrel now supports deterministic signatures.

topics.title: UTXO Alliance Events and Travel Plans
topics.summary: UTXO Alliance Twitter spaces coming soon, consensus conference in Hong Kong planned, and potential meetups in Thailand or Vietnam being considered.

topics.title: Real World Adoption Book Project
topics.summary: Kushti is working on a book about real-world adoption with invited contributors including Luivatra for storage rent and Joe for grassroots manifests. Current drafts will be open-sourced and combined writings published.

topics.title: Digital Identity and PKI Infrastructure Discussion
topics.summary: Kushti discussed the longstanding challenge of connecting digital identities to real-world identities, explaining public key infrastructure, web of trust models, and why this remains a hard problem after 30 years of cryptographic research.

topics.title: DuckPools Lending Protocol and IDO
topics.summary: DuckPools lending protocol IDO is ending soon, allowing users to lend SigmaUSD for yield. Sigmanauts earned $500 profit lending $2,500 SigmaUSD while waiting to pay Rare Evo. The protocol includes its own DAO separate from Paideia.

topics.title: BRICK Token Legal Considerations
topics.summary: QX addressed concerns about creating BRICK token at Cornell, comparing it to existing Big Red Bucks system. No plans to add monetary value or DEX listing, though students might create their own liquidity pools.

topics.title: Rosen Bridge Awareness in Cardano Ecosystem
topics.summary: Rosen Bridge is well-known in the Cardano ecosystem based on Rare Evo conference experience. The bridge is gaining recognition through proof-of-work marketing approach, building trust slowly across ecosystems.

topics.title: Programmable Money Developer Education
topics.summary: Kushti explained programmable money concept to local developers, which resonated better than smart contracts terminology. Developers showed interest in contributing to compilers and interpreters, understanding the engineering approach better than the 2014 decentralized computer concept.

topics.title: Umbrella Tokens and ChainCash Design Pattern
topics.summary: Kushti explained umbrella tokens pattern where parent tokens enable issuing certified child tokens through contracts. ChainCash example involves reserve tokens that can be issued with contract-based certification, creating a reusable design pattern.
